xeno.remoting.web

Class MessageServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • xeno.remoting.web.MessageServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class MessageServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet

    A servlet handling requests from the client side, encapsulating request & response data into JSON string, calling methods of the server side directly.

    Author:
    Kai Feng
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • publish

        public static void publish(String topic,
           Object data)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                           SerializationException

        Publishes topic data to all subscribed clients.

        Parameters:
        topic - The topic, cannot be null.
        data - The data.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the "topic" is null.
        SerializationException - Thrown when the "data" cannot be serialized into JSON string.

      • publish

        public static void publish(String topic,
           Object data,
           String clientId)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                           SerializationException

        Publishes topic data to specified subscribed client.

        Parameters:
        topic - The topic, cannot be null.
        data - The data.
        clientId - The subscribed client ID, cannot be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the "topic" or the "clientId" is null.
        SerializationException - Thrown when the "data" cannot be serialized into JSON string.

      • publish

        public static void publish(String topic,
           Object data,
           String... clientIds)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                           SerializationException

        Publishes topic data to specified subscribed clients.

        Parameters:
        topic - The topic, cannot be null.
        data - The data.
        clientIds - The subscribed client IDs, cannot be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the "topic" or the "clientIds" is null. Or thrown when any item in the "clientIds" is null.
        SerializationException - Thrown when the "data" cannot be serialized into JSON string.

                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                           SerializationException

        Please see publish(String, Object, String...) with Collection type of "clientIds" argument.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • getCharacterEncoding

        public static String getCharacterEncoding()

        Returns the way of characters encoding.

        This value could be set in the "web.xml" with the "init-param" node of this servlet named as "characterEncoding", and the default value is: "UTF-8".

        Returns:
        A string.

      • isDebugMode

        public static boolean isDebugMode()

        Returns whether this servlet will be startup in a debug mode or not.

        This value could be set in the "web.xml" with the "init-param" node of this servlet named as "debugMode", and the default value is: "false".

        If the value of this parameter sets to "true" (case insensitive), all JavaScripts generated by this servlet will in a readable format. And you could use "/xr/api" to see all available remote proxies and their APIs documentation. Otherwise, all JavaScripts generated by this servlet will be minified to reduce the size.

        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isIgnoreJson2Library

        public static boolean isIgnoreJson2Library()

        Returns whether this servlet will ignore to take/export "json2.js" as an implementation or not.

        This value could be set in the "web.xml" with the "init-param" node of this servlet named as "ignoreJson2Library", and the default value is: "false".

        If the value of this parameter sets to "true" (case insensitive), the content of "json2.js" will not be exported. This is because, for some modern browsers (e.g. IE8+, Firefox, Chrome, etc.), JSON has already be implemented and embed in the browser, so you need not this 3rd party library implementation any more.

        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • getSubscribeRefreshTime

        public static long getSubscribeRefreshTime()

        Returns the time (in millisecond) of each topic mapped subscription to refresh when no incoming message arrived. The refresh action means to abort current subscribing request and start a new one for the same topic.

        This value could be set in the "web.xml" with the "init-param" node of this servlet named as "subscribeRefreshTime", and the default value is: 120000.

        For the performance reason, if the value lower than 20, it will be converted into 20 automatically. And the value greater than 1200000 (20 minutes), it will be converted into 1200000 automatically.

        Returns:
        An int.

      • getWebApplicationServletContext

        public static javax.servlet.ServletContext getWebApplicationServletContext()
                                                                    throws IllegalStateException

        Returns the web application servlet context object.

        Returns:
        The servlet context, never be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when the servlet context has not been initialized.
